page.title: 11DAIRY FARMING IN A_J_M
page.content: {Dairy farming}is the main branch of agriculture.The two main breeds kept are{Friesians and Holsteins}The latter give more milk but the former better beef.The cow is first taken to a {Hereford bull},usually kept by the farmer as they are docile,because this gives a smaller calf.In subsequent years the cow will be{artificially {inseminated}with a Friesian or Holstein.The bull calves will probably be sold on at 4 weeks.The effect of the common agricultural policy of the {European Economic Community}which restricts the amount of milk sold by each farmer,called the{milk quota},has adversely affected the dairy farmer. Cow calves are less valuable than previously,and some farmers are diversifying into beef or cereals.
